entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 10.23.25
entry.summary: A Power of Pink interview with the Community Cancer Center Program Manager Angelia Freeman and CCC Registered Dietician and Board-Certified Specialist in Oncology Nutrition Ally Gottfried talking about how breast cancer survivors can improve their outcomes.

entry.title: Southern Oregon Fly Tying and Fishing Expo returns to Winston Community Center
entry.summary: WINSTON — The 2025 Southern Oregon Fly Tying and Fishing Expo is set to bring people instructions in fly tying, new ideas for fishing and more Saturday in Winston.

entry.title: A legacy of community service: What Yoncalla's Doris Bartlett left behind
entry.summary: YONCALLA — When a book is checked out from the Yoncalla Public Library, she's there. When a family hosts a get together at the Yoncalla Community Center, she's there. When a rider is bucked from a bull at the Yoncalla…

entry.title: The Optimist Club of Roseburg highlights haunted history with Ghosts of Roseburg Tour
entry.summary: Roseburg is a town steeped in history. Since its founding in 1851, the city has persisted through era after era of American history, from the pioneer days to the prohibition to the infamous Roseburg Blast.

entry.title: U.S. Bank to Close Drain Branch in January 2026
entry.summary: U.S. Bank will close its Drain branch on January 15, 2026. Officials say the move reflects a shift toward digital banking, with no disruption to customer accounts. The nearest branch will be in Cottage Grove. U.S. Bank also plans to close its Mill City branch days earlier on January 12.

entry.title: Roseburg School Board Prioritizes Funding for Locker Room Privacy Upgrades
entry.summary: The Roseburg School Board has approved up to $95,000 to add private changing and shower areas to Roseburg High School’s locker rooms. The upgrades aim to improve student comfort and privacy, with plans for individual stalls and enclosed spaces funded through the district’s 404 infrastructure fund.

entry.title: Goin’ Postal Hobbies & More Opens New Roseburg Location
entry.summary: Goin’ Postal has opened a new Roseburg location at 2210 Stewart Parkway, now called Goin’ Postal Hobbies & More. The store combines shipping services with toys, collectibles, and games at bargain prices. A grand opening sale offers $139.99 mailboxes through the end of the month.

entry.title: New Holiday Inn Express Nearing Completion in Roseburg
entry.summary: A new Holiday Inn Express on Northwest Mulholland Drive in Roseburg is nearly complete. The 100-room hotel, featuring an indoor pool, is expected to open in January as part of the Hanna Heritage Place development, expanding Roseburg’s hospitality and retail offerings.

entry.title: Roseburg school board passes motion to pursue private accommodations for locker rooms
entry.summary: It's an experience many are familiar with: filing into a locker room after P.E. class and changing into casual clothes in front of your classmates. But does this have to be the future for students in Roseburg schools?

entry.title: Roseburg Police to Host National Drug Take Back Day on October 24
entry.summary: The Roseburg Police Department will host National Drug Take Back Day on Friday, Oct. 24, 2025, from 8 a.m.–12 p.m. and 1–5 p.m. at 700 SE Douglas Ave. Residents can safely and anonymously dispose of unwanted or expired medications. Illicit substances will not be accepted.

entry.title: Lookingglass Fire District Secures Cardiac Monitor Through Community Donations
entry.summary: Lookingglass Rural Fire District has purchased its first-ever cardiac monitor thanks to $22,500 in community donations from the Cow Creek Band of Umpqua Tribe of Indians and the Ford Family Foundation. The new equipment will improve local emergency response and cardiac care.

entry.title: Roseburg Kicks Off Annual Leaf Collection in November
entry.summary: Roseburg’s annual leaf pickup runs Nov. 3–Dec. 31. Crews will start in Laurelwood Park and move clockwise through the city, collecting leaves to keep drains clear. Residents should pile leaves at the edge of their property. Updates: Roseburg Public Works website or 541-492-6730.

entry.title: Roseburg homeowners get free leaf pickup, mulch in November
entry.summary: Roseburg Public Works is launching its annual leaf collection service for city residents starting in November.

entry.title: New Additions Coming to Downtown Roseburg: The Majestic Theater and The Beckham Group
entry.summary: Downtown Roseburg is seeing new growth as two businesses prepare to open. The Majestic Theater and Big Picture Cafe will bring indie films and global flavors to SE Main St., while The Beckham Group relocates its real estate office to SE Jackson St., purchasing the building outright.

entry.title: NWS: Heavy Rain, Mountain Snow, and Wind Expected Across the Pacific Northwest
entry.summary: The National Weather Service warns of heavy rain, mountain snow, and gusty winds from Friday through Monday. Coastal areas could see dangerous surf, and drivers should watch for ponding on roads. Officials urge the public to rely on trusted NWS forecasts, not social media posts.

entry.title: Atmospheric River to Drench the Pacific Northwest: Clear Gutters and Drains
entry.summary: A series of storms will soak the Pacific Northwest starting Thursday night as an atmospheric river brings 2–6 inches of rain to western Oregon and Washington. Snow levels will drop to 2,500–3,000 feet by the weekend. Clear drains and prepare for minor flooding in low-lying or urban areas.

entry.title: Teen robbed at knifepoint, officer injured
entry.summary: A Roseburg man is in jail on $50,000 bail after a reported robbery and struggle with police. Raul Yanz Rosario, 41, is accused of robbing a 19-year-old of his wallet and later injuring an officer during his arrest near Fir Grove Park. He faces multiple felony and assault charges.

entry.title: Roseburg Fire Destroys Home on Fisher Road
entry.summary: A Roseburg man narrowly escaped after his home on Fisher Road caught fire Tuesday morning. Jim Barnes was asleep with earplugs in and woke only when passersby banged on his door. Central Douglas Fire & Rescue arrived within minutes, but the home and a nearby RV were already engulfed.

entry.title: The Single Point of Failure: Analyzing the Latest AWS Outage
entry.summary: The recent, multi-hour outage at Amazon Web Services (AWS) on Monday, October 20, 2025, served as a stark and costly reminder of how profoundly the global digital economy relies on a few core infrastructure providers. What began as a technical issue in a single US region—specifically, the crucial US-EAST-1 data center in Virginia—quickly cascaded into… The post The Single Point of Failure: Analyzing the Latest AWS Outage appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: UCC ART GALLERY PRESENTS OCCAM’S RAZOR NOW ON DISPLAY
entry.summary: October 20, 2025 2:50 a.m. In the KQEN Cultural Spotlight: The Art Gallery at Umpqua Community College is presenting a series of prints by Kim Fink that explore the world-at-large, including current social and political observations in “Occam’s Razor”. The show is on display at the Whipple Fine Arts Center at UCC through November 19th....
